description: Listed Building Consent: Repair works and reinstatement of damaged stone pier and railings to gates at Cedars Park.
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size:14pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">All new external and internal works and finishes and works of making good to the retained fabric shall match the existing adjacent work with regard to the methods used and to material, colour, texture and profile, unless shown otherwise on the drawings or other documentation hereby approved or required by any conditions(s) attached to this consent.<br>REASON: To protect the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.&nbsp;</span></span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:14pt">If previously unknown evidence is discovered about historic character which would be affected by the works hereby granted, an appropriate record, together with recommendations for dealing with it in the context of the scheme, shall be approved in writing by the local planning authority before any of the permitted works are begun. The works shall be completed in accordance with the approved details.<br>REASON: To protect the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.&nbsp;</span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:14pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">Suitable precautions shall be taken to secure and protect features against accidental loss or damage during the building work hereby granted, and no such features may be disturbed or removed, temporarily or permanently, except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior approval in writing of the local planning authority.<br>REASON: To protect the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span></span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:14pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, prior to reinstatement of missing parts as shown, suitable evidence through on site and documentary research by a suitable specialist shall be provided to demonstrate that this is not speculative restoration.</span></span></p><p><span style="font-size:14pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">Reason: To protect the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:14pt">Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, the proposed stone and masonry protector coating shall not be undertaken unless the following details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in advance of the relevant parts of the work:</span></p><p><span style="font-size:18.6667px">a) It can be demonstrated that it is necessary and not harmful to the listed building, and,</span></p><p><span style="font-size:14pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">b) If part a is met, trial areas are undertaken in suitable discreet areas.</span></span></p><p><span style="font-size:14pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">Reason: To preserve the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:14pt">Notwithstanding the existing and proposed elevations hereby approved, the brown heritage plaque as shown by site photographs from 2021 shall be resinstated&nbsp;as it was on the railings and retained in situ thereafter within 12 months of the date of this approval.<br>Reason: To preserve the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:14pt">Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, straightening and repairing railing damaged by the vehicle to the original curvature shall only include removal and replacement of historic fabric where it can be demonstrated that this is beyond repair, following survey and assessment by a suitable specialist to be submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. It shall otherwise be reinstated like for like in accordance with plans hereby approved.&nbsp;<br>Reason: To ameliorate the harm caused by the recent unauthorised works, to preserve the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span></p><p><br data-cke-eol="1"></p>

<p><span style="font-size:14pt">Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, prior to the commencement of the relevant repair works to the metal railings and gates, details, for the following are to be provided to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:&nbsp;<br>a) details for the retention of all of the existing layers of paint on a relatively concealed part of the listed gates and railings<br>b) method statement and trial area for removal of paint<br>Reason: To ameliorate the harm caused by the recent unauthorised works, to preserve the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:14pt">Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, paintwork to the existing metal railings and gates shall only be removed where it is judged to be necessary for assessment of condition by a suitable specialist.<br>Reason: To ameliorate the harm caused by the recent unauthorised works, to preserve the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span><br></p>

<div><span style="font-size:14pt">Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, prior to the commencement of the relevant repair works to the pillar that is to be reinstated, and after it has been cleaned, samples for the following are to be provided to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:&nbsp;<br>a) limestone samples&nbsp;<br>b) lime sand mix to match the existing (minimum of 5 variations and where necessary samples of existing mortar taken for analysis).<br>c) repointing<br>Reason: To ameliorate the harm caused by the recent unauthorised works, to preserve the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span></div><p><br data-cke-eol="1"></p>

<p><span style="font-size:14pt">Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, prior to the commencement of the repairs works to the metal gates and railings and reinstatement of the pillar, a method statement for the protection of the three remaining stone piers is to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This is to be implemented in full during the reconstruction works of the fourth pillar and removed thereafter.<br>Reason: To ameliorate the harm caused by the recent unauthorised works, to preserve the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:14pt">Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, the cleaning system for the pillar that is to be reinstated is not to carried out until details are agreed under condition 3a whereupon the cleaning of this pillar is to be carried out in accordance with those agreed details and prior to its reinstatement.<br>Reason: To ameliorate the harm caused by the recent unauthorised works, to preserve the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span><br></p>

<div><span style="font-size:14pt">Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, prior to the commencement of the relevant repair works to the three remaining pillars, details (including trial area and method statement &nbsp;where appropriate), for the following are to be provided to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:&nbsp;</span></div><div><span style="font-size:14pt">a) low-pressure steam cleaning system (no wet or abrasive)<br>b) stonework repairs using steel pins and epoxy resin.<br>c) repointing<br>d) missing cusped pier top, carved panel and bell pull with reference to evidence of what was in place previously<br>Reason: To ameliorate the harm caused by the recent unauthorised works, to preserve the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span><br></div>

<p><span style="font-size:14pt">Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, prior to commencement of any of the repair works hereby approved, a complete photographic record of the current condition of all elements (gates, railings and pillars that remain on site and off site) is to be carried out alongside a scale rule and submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.<br>Reason: To ameliorate the harm caused by the recent unauthorised works, to preserve the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:14pt">The remedial works proposed as part of this Listed Building Consent (reinstatement of pillar and repair of bent railings) must be completed within 12&nbsp;months of the date of this consent and shall be retained thereafter.<br>Reason: To ameliorate the harm caused by the recent demolition works, to preserve the special architectural or historic interest of the listed building.</span><br></p>
site_name: Historic Gate And Railings, The Cedars Open Space, Uxbridge Road
reference_no_of_permission_being_relied_:
P/3496/20 - For the repair and refurbishment of pillars, railings and gates. 
P/2774/21 -  Submission of details pursuant to conditions 2 (photographic record) and 8a (paint layers) attached to Listed Building Consent application reference P/3496/20 for Listed Building Consent: repair and refurbishment of pillars, railings and gates
